Divide intervals into new sub-intervals ("windows").

Divide intervals into new sub-intervals ("windows").

bed_makewindows(x, genome, win_size = 0, step_size = 0, num_win = 0,
  reverse = FALSE)

Arguments

x

tbl_interval()
genome

tbl_genome()
win_size

divide intervals into fixed-size windows
step_size

size to step before next window
num_win

divide intervals to fixed number of windows
reverse

reverse window numbers

Value

tbl_interval() with .win_id column that contains a numeric identifier for the window.

Note

The name and .win_id columns can be used to create new interval names (see 'namenum' example below) or in subsequent group_by operations (see vignette).

See also

Other utilities: bed12_to_exons

Examples

genome <- trbl_genome(
 ~chrom, ~size,
 "chr1", 200
)

x <- trbl_interval(
  ~chrom, ~start, ~end, ~name, ~score, ~strand,
  "chr1", 100,    200,  'A',   '.',    '+'
)

bed_glyph(bed_makewindows(x, genome, num_win = 10), label = '.win_id')

# Fixed number of windows
bed_makewindows(x, genome, num_win = 10)
#> # A tibble: 10 x 7
#>    chrom start   end  name score strand .win_id
#>    <chr> <int> <int> <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <int>
#>  1  chr1   100   110     A     .      +       1
#>  2  chr1   110   120     A     .      +       2
#>  3  chr1   120   130     A     .      +       3
#>  4  chr1   130   140     A     .      +       4
#>  5  chr1   140   150     A     .      +       5
#>  6  chr1   150   160     A     .      +       6
#>  7  chr1   160   170     A     .      +       7
#>  8  chr1   170   180     A     .      +       8
#>  9  chr1   180   190     A     .      +       9
#> 10  chr1   190   200     A     .      +      10

# Fixed window size
bed_makewindows(x, genome, win_size = 10)
#> # A tibble: 10 x 7
#>    chrom start   end  name score strand .win_id
#>    <chr> <int> <int> <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <int>
#>  1  chr1   100   110     A     .      +       1
#>  2  chr1   110   120     A     .      +       2
#>  3  chr1   120   130     A     .      +       3
#>  4  chr1   130   140     A     .      +       4
#>  5  chr1   140   150     A     .      +       5
#>  6  chr1   150   160     A     .      +       6
#>  7  chr1   160   170     A     .      +       7
#>  8  chr1   170   180     A     .      +       8
#>  9  chr1   180   190     A     .      +       9
#> 10  chr1   190   200     A     .      +      10

# Fixed window size with overlaps
bed_makewindows(x, genome, win_size = 10, step_size = 5)
#> # A tibble: 20 x 7
#>    chrom start   end  name score strand .win_id
#>    <chr> <int> <int> <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <int>
#>  1  chr1   100   110     A     .      +       1
#>  2  chr1   105   115     A     .      +       2
#>  3  chr1   110   120     A     .      +       3
#>  4  chr1   115   125     A     .      +       4
#>  5  chr1   120   130     A     .      +       5
#>  6  chr1   125   135     A     .      +       6
#>  7  chr1   130   140     A     .      +       7
#>  8  chr1   135   145     A     .      +       8
#>  9  chr1   140   150     A     .      +       9
#> 10  chr1   145   155     A     .      +      10
#> 11  chr1   150   160     A     .      +      11
#> 12  chr1   155   165     A     .      +      12
#> 13  chr1   160   170     A     .      +      13
#> 14  chr1   165   175     A     .      +      14
#> 15  chr1   170   180     A     .      +      15
#> 16  chr1   175   185     A     .      +      16
#> 17  chr1   180   190     A     .      +      17
#> 18  chr1   185   195     A     .      +      18
#> 19  chr1   190   200     A     .      +      19
#> 20  chr1   195   200     A     .      +      20

# reverse win_id
bed_makewindows(x, genome, win_size = 10, reverse = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 10 x 7
#>    chrom start   end  name score strand .win_id
#>    <chr> <int> <int> <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <int>
#>  1  chr1   100   110     A     .      +      10
#>  2  chr1   110   120     A     .      +       9
#>  3  chr1   120   130     A     .      +       8
#>  4  chr1   130   140     A     .      +       7
#>  5  chr1   140   150     A     .      +       6
#>  6  chr1   150   160     A     .      +       5
#>  7  chr1   160   170     A     .      +       4
#>  8  chr1   170   180     A     .      +       3
#>  9  chr1   180   190     A     .      +       2
#> 10  chr1   190   200     A     .      +       1

# bedtools 'namenum'
wins <- bed_makewindows(x, genome, win_size = 10)
dplyr::mutate(wins, namenum = stringr::str_c(name, '_', .win_id))
#> # A tibble: 10 x 8
#>    chrom start   end  name score strand .win_id namenum
#>    <chr> <int> <int> <chr> <chr>  <chr>   <int>   <chr>
#>  1  chr1   100   110     A     .      +       1     A_1
#>  2  chr1   110   120     A     .      +       2     A_2
#>  3  chr1   120   130     A     .      +       3     A_3
#>  4  chr1   130   140     A     .      +       4     A_4
#>  5  chr1   140   150     A     .      +       5     A_5
#>  6  chr1   150   160     A     .      +       6     A_6
#>  7  chr1   160   170     A     .      +       7     A_7
#>  8  chr1   170   180     A     .      +       8     A_8
#>  9  chr1   180   190     A     .      +       9     A_9
#> 10  chr1   190   200     A     .      +      10    A_10
